column4: I can't mount my usb flash pen drive on ubuntu 10.04, tried to do it manually but it doesn't even appear when i type: "sudo fdisk -l".
plug/unplug the usb and then run dmesg | tail -n 20
can't do copy paste, but it doesn't say anything like "sdb1". I'm chatting with my mac.
does it say anything about the usb bus? does it identify that the device was plugged in?
yes, it says: new high speed USB device using ehci_hcd and address 20, configuration #1 chosen from 1 choice
the next couple of lines should indicate what kernel driver attached to the device, and it should also give the device id
it stops after the two lines i told you, i even made tail -f, and nothing else pops up
odd. the kernel is not recognizing it. one would expect the usb mass storage driver to attach to the device. if that doesn't happen you can't do anything with it
where did you get the usb stick
I have 3 usb sticks that I'm trying to make work: they are kingston, one i bought it, 2 from work, i've been using them before successfully.
i can try to reformat them? i'll google how to do it.
check "lsmod | grep usb_storage" i dont think you can even reformat unless they are recognized as mass storage
i can read them fin with my mac, only ubuntu don't recognize them.
modprobe usb_storage. is udevd running? it should be handling this for you
modprobe usb_storage returned 3 WARNING: All config files need .conf: /etc/modprobe.d/ndiswrapper, it will be ignored in a future release. blacklist too.
i see the usb flash pen drive!!!! whas it the last command i guess.....
usb_storage is the driver that attaches to the device. i would have expected udevd to modprobe it on your behalf. not sure why it isn't
